Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class Controller extends Object implements Observer
The Controller class manages the flow of the game, including level transitions and error handling. It acts as an observer to the current game level and responds to level transition events.

  • Field Details

    • LEVEL_ONE_CLASS_NAME

      private static final String LEVEL_ONE_CLASS_NAME
      The fully qualified class name for the first level of the game. This is used to dynamically load and initialize Level One during gameplay.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • stage

      private final javafx.stage.Stage stage
      The primary Stage used for displaying the game's graphical user interface. This is the main window where the game content is rendered.

    • currentLevel

      private LevelParent currentLevel
      The current active level instance in the game. This field holds a reference to the level that is currently being played.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Constructs a Controller instance associated with a specific stage.
      Parameters:
      stage - the JavaFX stage to be managed by the controller

  • Method Details

    • launchGame

      public void launchGame()
      Launches the game by displaying the stage and loading the first level. This method ensures the game starts in the JavaFX application thread.

    • goToLevel

      public void goToLevel(String className) throws Exception
      Switches to the specified level by its class name. If the level is already loaded, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      className - the fully qualified class name of the level to switch to
      Throws:
      Exception - if the level cannot be loaded or instantiated

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      Responds to updates from the observed level, such as level transitions. Executes the level transition logic on the JavaFX application thread.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - the observable object (the current level)
      arg - the argument passed by the observable (typically the next level's class name)

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(String title, Exception e)
      Displays an alert dialog with error details to the user.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert dialog
      e - the exception to display details for
